dspace-development.title: Symplectic Elements Scheduling service is not connected to the database (production)

comments.body:
From 04/18/22 - 04/28/22, there appears to be no data logged for the Symplectic Scheduler service:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/cd35f1e6-4a77-47f9-b6c0-528a70fd0474)

The following is the last trace of the Scheduling service with regards to logged activity on 04/18/22:

```bash
2022-04-18 04:19:56: Job 33 (Reporting Synchroniser) next scheduled for execution at 4/18/2022 4:24:28 AM
2022-04-18 04:20:00: The cache monitor experienced many consecutive errors while polling for cache changes, and will be paused for    300 seconds.
2022-04-18 04:20:00: Cache monitor stopped.
2022-04-18 04:20:00: Cache monitor started (delay - 300 seconds).
2022-04-18 04:24:35: Scheduler API stopped.
```

The following attempts to restart the service on 04/28/22:

```bash
2022-04-28 14:07:11: Licence loaded.
2022-04-28 14:07:11: Licence monitor started.
2022-04-28 14:07:11: Service started.
2022-04-28 14:07:25: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:07:26: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:07:26: Cache monitor started (delay - 10 seconds).
2022-04-28 14:07:26: Scheduler API started.
2022-04-28 14:07:34: Received Indigo Service instruction to list jobs.
2022-04-28 14:07:48: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:07:48: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get the current list of jobs schedule.
2022-04-28 14:07:48: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:07:54: Received Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 15.
2022-04-28 14:07:54: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 15.
2022-04-28 14:07:54: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:07:57: The cache monitor experienced many consecutive errors while polling for cache changes, and will be paused for    300 seconds.
2022-04-28 14:07:57: Cache monitor stopped.
2022-04-28 14:07:57: Cache monitor started (delay - 300 seconds).
2022-04-28 14:08:08: Received Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:22: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:22: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:08:25: Received Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:25: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:25: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:08:27: Received Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:27: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:27: Loading cache...
```

It is unclear to me what exactly resolved the following error:

```bash
2022-04-28 14:08:22: Loading cache...
2022-04-28 14:08:25: Received Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
2022-04-28 14:08:25: An error occurred while executing an Indigo Service instruction to get job status for job 33.
```

However, this cache or job was eventually cleared (as this error did not persist).

comments.body:
The deployment was breaking with the following error:

```bash
Err:14 https://oss-binaries.phusionpassenger.com/apt/passenger bionic Release
  Certificate verification failed: The certificate is NOT trusted. The certificate chain uses expired certificate.  Could not handshak
e: Error in the certificate verification. [IP: 109.107.35.58 443]
Get:15 https://repositories.timber.io/public/vector/deb/ubuntu bionic InRelease [4,934 B]
Reading package lists... Done
```

The following resolved the issue:
```bash
pulsys@oawaiver-staging1:~$ sudo apt install ca-certificates
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following packages will be upgraded:
  ca-certificates
1 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 154 not upgraded.
Need to get 145 kB of archives.
After this operation, 2,048 B disk space will be freed.

Fetched 145 kB in 0s (1,883 kB/s)                                                                                                     Preconfiguring packages ...
(Reading database ... 71758 files and directories currently installed.)                                                               Preparing to unpack .../ca-certificates_20210119~18.04.2_all.deb ...
Unpacking ca-certificates (20210119~18.04.2) over (20210119~18.04.1) ...                                                              Setting up ca-certificates (20210119~18.04.2) ...
Updating certificates in /etc/ssl/certs...                                                                                            0 added, 1 removed; done.
Processing triggers for man-db (2.8.3-2ubuntu0.1) ...
Processing triggers for ca-certificates (20210119~18.04.2) ...
Updating certificates in /etc/ssl/certs...
0 added, 0 removed; done.
Running hooks in /etc/ca-certificates/update.d...
done.
```

orangelight.title: Location and Call Number Should be included in "email-a-record" feature.

comments.body:
Please note that this required some updates for the database records within the `staging` environment:

```bash
pdc_describe_staging=> select id,title,code from collections;
 id |                title                | code
----+-------------------------------------+------
  1 | Research Data                       | RD
  3 | Electronic Theses and Dissertations | ETD
  4 | Library Resources                   | LIB
  2 | Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory | PPPL
  5 | Research Data                       | RD
  6 | Research Data                       | RD
(6 rows)

pdc_describe_staging=> update collections set code='FOO' where id=6;
UPDATE 1
pdc_describe_staging=> update collections set code='BAR' where id=5;
UPDATE 1
pdc_describe_staging=> select id,title,code from collections;
 id |                title                | code
----+-------------------------------------+------
  1 | Research Data                       | RD
  3 | Electronic Theses and Dissertations | ETD
  4 | Library Resources                   | LIB
  2 | Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory | PPPL
  6 | Research Data                       | FOO
  5 | Research Data                       | BAR
(6 rows)
```

Also note that this shall *not* be necessary for the production environment:

```bash
pdc_describe_prod=> select id,title,code from collections;
 id |                title                | code
----+-------------------------------------+------
  1 | Research Data                       | RD
  2 | Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory | PPPL
  3 | Electronic Theses and Dissertations | ETD
  4 | Library Resources                   | LIB
(4 rows)
```

princeton_ansible.title: [Bibdata-staging] TASK [common : common | Add apt HTTPS capabilities.] ->  failed

comments.body:
**solution**:
run : `sudo apt-get update` will return the public key that errors
run: `sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys <publickey>`
thank you @kayiwa

We discussed possibly removing the `update_cache: true` line from most if not all apt tasks and moving that operation into a separate playbook or tasks file that does not run every time the `common` role runs.

When `update_cache` is set to `true`, Ansible tries to update the local index/list of packages and versions available from apt - the Ansible equivalent of typing `sudo apt-get update`. This is useful in general - it's a good idea to keep the apt index up-to-date. However, most of our apt tasks don't upgrade packages, so we don't absolutely need to update the cache before running most of them. And updating the cache does fail fairly often due to changing keys and other issues, which blocks other work from getting done.

Updating the cache is non-destructive and can be done on all infrastructure on a regular basis. So if we have a separate playbook for updating the apt cache, we can run it monthly or quarterly and fix any issues that come up.

pulfalight.title: pulfalight-staging can't connect to pony express
enable OARSC functionality for zip downloads
Embed viewers and download links from figgy graphql endpoint
Figgy should synchronize finding aid data that hasn't yet been published in aspace

comments.body:
Reopened because there are several ways / places a resource can be unpublished.

* At the collection level (the whole collection is unpublished)
  * This is the case that's implemented. Ensure we have tests that enforce a component not marked unpublished within a collection marked unpublished has `audience` value `internal`. yes we have them:  https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/blob/0ec2086583c206d8a6a42edf05225aaca8b7aa2b/spec/jobs/aspace_index_job_spec.rb#L34
* At the component level (the collection is published but some component/s are not)
  * example components
    * C0140_c87678-60535
    * https://aspace.princeton.edu/staff/resources/3950#tree::archival_object_1461066
* At the field level
  * We think this may only be an option for notes-type fields.
  * a field that's unpublished should never be indexed and does not need to sync.
We also need to update the record export from aspace to include unpublished components on published collections.
